definition: A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
surname Shi
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
to tell to
dialect/language/speech

sentences.english: The paper discusses the connotation of the title of Shishuoxiyu.
sentences.chinese: 本文讨论了《世说新语》题名的内涵。

sentences.english: The second part is a list of synonymous groups.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是《世说新语》中实义动词同义词组列表。

sentences.english: Xie'an, a character in Shishuoxinyu (Anecdotes of Famous Houses in Wei and Jin Dynasties) attaches great importance to the education of the young of the house.
sentences.chinese: 谢安是《世说新语》中最重视教育家族子弟的人物。

sentences.english: The third chapter elaborates the idea of female aesthetics.
This text is about the grammar study on adverbs in Shi Shuo Xin Yu.
sentences.chinese: 本文对《世说新语》中的副词进行语法上的研究。

sentences.english: May say "Shi Shuo Xin Yu" is the crystallization which Liu Yiqing and the Liu Jun two people cooperate.
sentences.chinese: 可以说《世说新语》是刘义庆和刘峻两人合作的结晶。

sentences.english: This book-- is a book that has recorded the true stories of the intellectuals in that period.
sentences.chinese: 《世说新语》一书是魏晋士人生活的真实记录。

sentences.english: This text differentiates and analyses the modality adverbs which have same form but belong to different category.
sentences.chinese: 文章对《世说新语》的同形异类语气副词进行辨析。

sentences.english: Once more, you open the door, And you're here in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 你要是再开门，世说新语，在心里我还要日。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter is an analysis of the influence of gender aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 《世说新语》性别审美观的影响分析。

definition: Liu Yiqing (403-444), writer of South Song Dynasty, compiler and editor of A New Account of the Tales of the World 世說新語|世说新语[Shi4 shuo1 Xin1 yu3]
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls

A Mirror for the Wise Ruler (or Comprehensive Mirror for Aid in Government), a vast chronological general history, written by 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] Sima Guang (1019-1089) and collaborators during the Northern Song in 1084, covering the period 403 BC-959 AD, 294 scrolls

History of Eastern Han (later Han), third of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Fan Ye 范曄|范晔[Fan4 Ye4] in 445 during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4], 120 scrolls
Extensive records of the Taiping era (978), fictional history edited by Li Fang 李昉
"Strategies of the Warring States", chronicle of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC), possibly written by Su Qin 蘇秦|苏秦[Su1 Qin2]
historian from Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋, author of History of Eastern Han 後漢書|后汉书
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls

History of Qi of the Southern Dynasties, seventh of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Xiao Zixian 蕭子顯|萧子显[Xiao1 Zi3 xian3] in 537 during Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁[Nan2 chao2 Liang2], 59 scrolls

History of Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4] or Liu Song 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], sixth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Shen Yue 沈約|沈约[Shen2 Yue4] in 488 during Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁[Nan2 chao2 Liang2], 100 scrolls/(not to be confused with 宋史[Song4 shi3])

Romance of the Three Kingdoms by Luo Guanzhong 羅貫中|罗贯中[Luo2 Guan4 zhong1], one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature/a fictional account of the Three Kingdoms at the break-up of the Han around 200 AD, consistently portraying Liu Bei's Shu Han 劉備|刘备, 蜀漢|蜀汉 as virtuous heroes and Cao Cao's Wei 曹操, 魏 as tyrannical villains
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
History of the Three Kingdoms, fourth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Chen Shou 陳壽|陈寿[Chen2 Shou4] in 289 during Jin Dynasty 晉朝|晋朝[Jin4 chao2], 65 scrolls
History of the Southern Dynasties, fourteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Li Yanshou 李延壽|李延寿[Li3 Yan2 shou4] in 659 during Tang Dynasty, 80 scrolls
dissipated/unruly
